project_short_name.description: Project name abbreviation; the program name appended with a project name abbreviation; eg. TCGA-OV, etc.

primary_site.description: Anatomical site of the cancer under investigation or review

tumor_sample_barcode.description: Tumor sample barcode, eg TCGA-12-1089-01A. One sample may have multiple sets of CN segmentations corresponding to multiple aliquots; use GROUP BY appropriately in queries

normal_sample_barcode.description: Normal sample barcode, eg TCGA-12-1089-01A. One sample may have multiple sets of CN segmentations corresponding to multiple aliquots; use GROUP BY appropriately in queries

gene_id.description: The Ensembl gene ID from the underlying file, including the version suffix -- eg. ENSG00000235943.1

Ensembl_gene_id.description: The Ensembl gene ID from the underlying file, but stripped of the version suffix -- eg. ENSG00000185028

Ensembl_gene_id_v.description: The Ensembl gene ID from the underlying file, including the version suffix -- eg. ENSG00000235943.1

gene_type.description: The type of genetic element the reads mapped to, eg. protein_coding, ribozyme

chromosome.description: Chromosome, possible values: chr1-22, and chrX

copy_number.description: The weighted median of the strand copy numbers. Gene-level copy number data is generated by intersection of copy number segment and gene ranges. It is possible for one gene to overlap with multiple segments, and in this case, copy_number, min_copy_number and max_copy_number could take different values. In particular, the copy_number value is calculated as the median, weighted on length of overlapped bases, of segment copy numbers from all overlapped segments.

min_copy_number.description: The lowest copy number for overlapped segment (copy number variant only).

max_copy_number.description: The highest copy number for overlapped segment (copy number variant only).

source_file_id.description: Unique GDC identifier for the file containing the expression values (corresponds to the file_barcode)

case_gdc_id.description: Unique GDC identifier for this case (corresponds to the case_barcode).  Can be used to access more information from the GDC data portal like this:   https://portal.gdc.cancer.gov/files/c21b332c-06c6-4403-9032-f91c8f407ba10

tumor_sample_gdc_id.description: Unique GDC identifier for the tumor sample (corresponds to the sample_barcode), eg a1ec9279-c1a6-4e58-97ed-9ec1f36187c5  --  this can be used to access more information from the GDC data portal

normal_sample_gdc_id.description: Unique GDC identifier for the normal sample (corresponds to the sample_barcode), eg a1ec9279-c1a6-4e58-97ed-9ec1f36187c5  --  this can be used to access more information from the GDC data portal

tumor_tissue_type.description: A description of the kind of tissue collected with respect to disease status or proximity to tumor tissue for the tumor sample.

normal_tissue_type.description: A description of the kind of tissue collected with respect to disease status or proximity to tumor tissue for the normal sample.

tumor_tissue_descriptor.description: A description the kind of disease present in the tumor specimen as related to a specific timepoint for the tumor sample.

nomral_tissue_descriptor.description: A description the kind of disease present in the tumor specimen as related to a specific timepoint for the normal sample.

tumor_aliquot_gdc_id.description: Unique GDC identifier for the tumor aliquot (corresponds to the aliquot_barcode), eg 7fbfdb3e-1fd2-4206-8d2e-7f68e4a15844  --  this can be used to access more information from the GDC data portal

normal_aliquot_gdc_id.description: Unique GDC identifier for the normal aliquot (corresponds to the aliquot_barcode), eg 7fbfdb3e-1fd2-4206-8d2e-7f68e4a15844  --  this can be used to access more information from the GDC data portal

file_gdc_id.description: Unique GDC identifier for this file (corresponds to the file_barcode)  --  this can be used to access more information from the GDC data portal like this: https://portal.gdc.cancer.gov/files/c21b332c-06c6-4403-9032-f91c8f407ba17
